tasks.task: Attend a KANA meeting with Extension officers to select rice variety and create a crop calendar.

Create raised areas and compacted earth ridges in fields.
Position a tube in the field to monitor water level.
Plant during the beginning of the rainy Maha season (first week of October) instead of later.
Avoid broadcasting seeds; use line seeders, drum seeders, or direct seeding.

Manage weeds for the first 30 days.

Irrigate when water level is 5 cm above surface, then drain until 15 cm below.
Monitor weeds and irrigate as needed (e.g., one week after flowering, two weeks after).
Maintain water level 0-5 cm above surface two weeks before harvest.
Allow fields to drain gradually before harvesting.
Check moisture level (20-25% dry), around 3.5 months after planting (week 12) for the recommended variety.
Utilize mobile paddy drying for efficient storage.
Consider FAO's approach to climate-smart crop production.
Use adapted rice varieties resistant to common pests/diseases.
Request a transplanting service from the one-stop super if your plot is ≥0.2 hectares.
For crops managed through weeding after 30 days, possibly use additional manual or mechanical weeding.

tasks.task: Monitor water levels and field drainage.
subtasks: Check water levels and manage drainage accordingly.
Allow fields to drain when water reaches 15 cm below surface level.
Appoint a water controller as advised by Extension officers.
Regularly attend to stay informed on sustainable practices.
